definitions.title: adv.
definitions.body: (perh. from the same demonstr, root found also in [[כִּי]], [[כּׂה]], [[כֵּן]]).
with a restrictive force, emphasizing what follows:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: in contrast to what precedes, howbeit;

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: in contrast with other ideas generally, only

asseverative, often introducing with emphasis the expression of a truth (or supposed truth) newly perceived, esp. in colloquial language, surely, no doubt (doch wohl); Ge 26:9 [[אַךְ הִנֵּה אִשְׁתְּךָ הִוא]] of a surety, lo, she is thy wife ! Ge 29:14, Ge 44:28, Ju Jdg 3:24, Jdg 20:39, 1Sa 16:6 surely the anointed of ´[[י]] is before him ! 1Sa 25:21, Je 5:4, Ps 58:12, Ps 73:1, Ps 73:13; but also in other cases, though rarely, Is 34:14, Is 34:15, Zep 3:7, Ps 23:6, Ps 139:11, Ps 140:14, Job 16:7, Job 18:21; & rather singularly Ex 12:15, Ex 31:13, Le 23:27, Le 23:39 (all P).

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: in contrast to what precedes, howbeit, yet, but : Ge 9:4 howbeit, flesh with the life thereof…ye shall not eat, Ge 20:12, Ex 21:21, Le 21:23, Le 27:26, Nu 18:15, Nu 18:17, 2Sa 3:13; Je 10:24 correct me, [[אַךְ בְּמִשְׁפָּט]] but with judgment, Job 2:6, Job 13:15; sts. with an advers. force, as Is 14:15 Is 43:24; before an imper. (minimizing the request), Ge 23:13 only, if thou wilt, I pray thee, hear me ! Ge 27:13, Ju Jdg 10:15, 1Sa 18:17, 1Ki 17:13 al. So 1 S 1Sa 8:9 [[אַךְ כִּי]] (v. [[כִּי]]; and cf. plh\n o(/ti).

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: in contrast to other ideas generally :—(a) Ge 7:23, Ge 18:32 [[אַךְ]] [[הַפַּעַם]] only this once (so Ex 10:17 al.) Ge 34:15, Ex 12:16 (note accents), 1Sa 18:8 [[וְעוֹד לוֹ אַךְ תַמְּלוּכָה]] and there yet remains for him only the kingdom, 1Sa 21:5, Is 45:14 [[אַךָ בְּךָ אֵל]] only in thee is God! Ps 62:2 etc. Job 14:22; Ps 37:8 fret not thyself [[אַךְ]] [[לְהָרֵעַ]] (which leadeth) only to do evil, Pr 11:24 he that withholdeth more than is meet [[אַךְ]] [[לְמַחְסוֹר]] (tendeth) only to penury, Pr 14:23, Pr 21:5, Pr 22:16; (b) attaching itself closely to the foll. word (usually an adj., rarely a verb), only, i.e. exclusively, altogether, utterly De 16:15 and thou shalt be [[אַךְ שָׂמֵחַ]] altogether rejoicing, De 28:29 (cf. v:De 28:33 [[רַק]]) Is 16:7 [[אַךְ נְכָאִים]] utterly stricken, Is 19:11, Je 16:19 nought but lies, Je 32:30, Ho 12:12, Job 19:13 [[אַךְ זׇרוּ]] are wholly estranged (with play on [[אַכְזׇר]] cruel).

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: as an adv. of time (with inf. abs.), twice: Ge 27:30 [[וְעֵשָׂו בָּא]]…[[אַךְ יׇחאׁ יׇחָא יַעֲקׂב]] only just (or scarcely) had Jacob gone out,…and (= when) Esau came in, Ju Jdg 7:19.—[[וְאַח]] thrice : Ge 9:5 and only (second limitation of v:Ge 9:3); Nu 22:20 but only; Jos 22:19 but howbeit.

definitions.title: Def
definitions.body: Note.—In some passages the affirmative and restrictive senses agree equally with the context; and authorities read the Hebrew differently. Thus only = nought but, altogether, is adopted by Ges Ew Hi De in Ps 23:6, Ps 62:10, Ps 73:1, Ps 73:13; by Ew Hi De in Ps 39:6, Ps 39:7 (Che surely); by Ges Ew De in Ps 39:12 (but Hi Che surely); by Ew Hi in Ps 73:18 (De Che surely); by Ges Hi De in Ps 139:11 (Ew doch). Is 45:14 Ges Ew Hi Di only; but De Che of a truth.
